result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonny R. Albaugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lonny R. Albaugh is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lonny R. Albaugh was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

records.addlTxt: terminated - regular
per Jack @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

1:30 p.m. Defendant Lonny R. Albaugh in court.  Defendant is looking for work; does not have driver's license. Defendant's plan is to get a job and start making payments. Defendant has no money on him. Gets about $175/week in back child support - can begin making payments with that money. Court advises defendant to make payments prior to next court date. Payment plan application given to defendant with instructions to provide to Clerk with 1st payment. Adj. 1:34 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
From Mr. Albaugh, he is stranded out of town because his car broke down.  He hopes to return tomorrow.  No money for fine.  Told to call when he returns and we will schedule a voluntary appearance.
from defendant
Review hearing on January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

With Defendant, cannot pay $50 until released from Vilas county Jail 3 months from now.  Asked why he waited to request this till the day he has to report and he had no explanation.  Suggested he write to Judge O'Melia with his request.

Defendant Lonny R. Albaugh in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bennett statement to court - requests warrant to be quashed that was authorized this week and would like to go to plea and sentencing and provides court with Plea Questionnaire.  State would amend County #1 to Possession of Controlled Substance 961.47(3)(b) with 1 yr with prob/aoda and moves to dismiss count 2.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Court grants motion to amend and dismisses count #2.  Bennett statement to court/defendant statement

Court sentencing:

WHS/POP 1 year
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
Court costs $443 at rate of $50.00 a month starting next month.
Voluntary appearance on August 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:30
No appearance by defendant - Bennett statement - Court authorizes warrant -

10:13 a.m. Defendant Lonny R. Albaugh in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State will provide Information consistent with Complaint. Bennett waives reading of Information - enters not guilty pleas. Bail continued. Adj. 10:14 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

Defendant Lonny R. Albaugh in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:57
In receipt, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
- includes cover letter

In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel-has contacted PD's office, Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:25 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
